text: Color naranja, turbio, con capa de espuma blanca de dos dedos de grosor (no mucha retención). Carbonatación suave. Textura acuosa y un poco chispeante. Aroma a cítricos, melocotón, resina. Sabor cítrico, con mucho melocotón, algo de piña. Final resinoso y herbal de amargor moderado. Rica.

Draught at Ölrepubliken. Backlog
Deep GN with a white head. 
Rather light with tropical fruits and flowey notes. 
Medium bitterness.

Bottle. Honey pour with bubbly white head. Sharp hops in the aroma - lots of honey and oats in the nose. Some stickiness. Mildly carbonated, finishes with faint hops - goes easy despite all the hops in the nose. Accomplishes the job of a session IPA.

On tap, Beer + Burger in Willesden. Pale golden colour, white foam, looks like lager. Fine balance this, there really isnt much going on with the yeast or malts, clean and easy drinking with low bitterness, so its all about the hop fruitiness which fortunately comes through at the end with a soft blueberry and slightly citric kick. Not generally my favourite style but a nice refreshing summery ale.

On tap @satellite. 
Aroma is malty and hoppy, quite fresh. The Mosaic is clearly noticeable. 
Hazy golden color with very thin white head. 
Malty first, fruity then and lightly bitter in the end. 
Palate is a bit oily, light body and low carbonation. 
Very nice and well done session IPA. Very refreshing and easy to drink. Best friend of your summer.
On tap, Sorbon Stockholm. Light yellow with some haze. Fruity aroma, good malty taste. The Mosaic is quite pwerful in this one, but it is quite a good session IPA. Good piny finish.
Golden with a white head - Herbal hop aroma - Malt body with hops that gives flavours of citrus an some herbs - Hops with citrus and herbal flavours goes into the finish - This was nice

Draught @ Brew By Numbers Brewery, 79 Enid Street, Bermondsey, Greater London, England SE16 3RA. [ As Brew By Numbers 11/03 Session IPA - Mosaic ].Unclear matt medium orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, caramel, moderate to heavy hoppy, orange - citrus, pine, spruce, fruity, light peach. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average duration, mango, woody, hoppy, minerals, orange, peach. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150801]
 7-3-7-3-14

Bottle from honest brew. Hazy gold to orange. Thin to medium white persistent head. Taste is medium bitter. Body is medium and dry. Aroma is orange, pineapple, resin, hops. Flavour is pine, resin, hops, blueberries, orange zest. Awesome!

Bottle from Hops & Crafts Exeter. Pours beautifully golden with a slight haze & a thin white head. Gorgeous zesty tropical fruit aroma of grapefruit,passionfruit,papaya,orange,mango with some pine. Taste is more zesty tropical fruit as per the aroma with some balancing Bready malt. Light bodied & dry ,crisp & refreshing the finish is not as pronounced in flavours as the taste or aroma but has more hop fruit ,pine & Bready ,biscuity malt . A good well made session IPA !!!

Keg at The Hanging Bat. Pours murky blond, almost no head - not tempting look. Nose is juicy citrus, passionfruit, grass. Tastes follows being very juicy, especially with lower abv, passionfruit, mango, grass, gentle hop bite. Good balance and very sessionable indeed.

On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */: pours golden color, slightly clear with foamy white head; intense hop aroma, with notes of passionfruit, blueberry, mango, with some floral elements....flavor: malt backbone with crisp, bread like charakter is pretty well balanced with hop flavor, with notes mentioned above. Body is light to medium, texture is soft, carbonation is medium.
Draft at Kaapse fest. Golden color. Nice aroma of tropical fruit, citrus and fresh hops. Fresh taste of tropical citric fruits and fresh hops. Good stuff.

On tap at Kaapse Brouwers 2nd Anniversary Festival, Rotterdam. 
Nose is grass, citrus. 
Body is opalescent yellow, head is medium white, creamy, average lasting, good lacing. 
Aroma is grass, weed, light grapefruit, honey. 
Medium sweet, medium bitter, light fruity sour. 
Finish is long lasting hoppy medium bitter. 
Medium body, dry texture, soft carbonation. 
Easy, refreshing, simple but very tasty, great one.
Keg at the Earl of essex. Pours hazy yellow, nose is pine, citrus, taste is juicy fruit, sweet, dry.

(Brew By Numbers 11/03 Session IPA - Mosaic) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a shaker, ABV 3.8%, only four months between bottling and best before?
Pale orange colour on the body, mostly clear, with a two fingers tall white head on top, thin but with good retention.
Aroma of faint citrus, tangerine, some tropical fruits.
Nice taste, light citrusy and fruity, nice hop presence.
Thin body with good carbonation.
Pretty good, easy to drink.

Bue trop vieille, la fraîcheur nest plus là.
Nez très agrumes, orange amère, beaucoup de mangue, ananas, un fond dherbes fraîches.
Bouche assez légère, équilibrée, aqueuse mais très aromatique. Très ananas, mangue, herbe fraîche et agrume.
Super longueur.
Vraiment excellente, je reverrai la boîte fraîche.

0.33 l bottle from De Bierkoning at 3.8% abv, bottled in February 2016. Minimally hazy, orangeish amber with a thin, frothy, stable, white head. Intense, fruity-grassy, slightly floral aroma of mango, lots of passion fruit, grapefruit and some pine. Slightly bitter, fruity-grassy and slightly floral taste of mango, passion fruit, grapefruit and flowers, followed by a crisp, grassy-bitter, minimally resiny finish. Thin to medium body (but not watery!), slightly effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very aromatic and highly refreshing, just spot on!

Keg @ Victorian Craft Beer Café, Halifax. Slightly hazed amber-yellow with a thin head. Has a gritty hoppy-fruity taste and active in the palate. Has a good tropical fruit nose, but thinner in its taste.
Bottle from the Crafty Bottle, Lincoln. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruity peach, taste light sweet with a mid bitter finish.

On tap at brewery. Among the very best session ipa's I've tasted. Great aroma, easy on the palate and nice dry aftertaste. Reminds me of the best session beers from Vermont.
Very well done.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From tap at Taphouse. Hazy tellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of peach, fruit, hops, malt and light bitterness.

Taster at Taphouse. High creamy and lasting off-white head. Hazy milky light yellow green body. Acicic grapefruit lemon pine grass aroma. Relatively sweet and smooth creamy grapefruit dominated flavor with a fair amount of hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long finish.

Aroma: exotic fruits, mango, overripe passion fruit. Appearance: hazy, pale gold, medium, creamy, white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: bitters continue, citrus fruits, light oranges, some floral hops. Overall: very nice Session IPA, fantastic aroma. Pint at Craft Beer Rising, Shoreditch.

Pours hazy amber with two fingers of white head. Aroma of mango, grapefruit, passion fruit. Taste is mild to medium bitter with a light fruit finish. Very light yet smooth body with average carbonation.
KRS 241115. Golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is pine, malt, grapefruit. Flavour is pine, malt, hop, grapefruit, passion fruit, pineapple, orange. Bitter finish. Medium body. Nice beer.

Bottle from Gulating, Vestkanten.Pours hazy golden with a big creamy white head. Strong inviting aroma of tropical fruits, orange, tangerine and passion fruit. Taste is dry, with a light sweet tropical fruity note, long dry fruity delicious finish.Very good.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. BBNO tap takeover. Light hay golden pour with a frothy head. Notes of melon, peach, light bitterness and lemon juice.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours light hazy orange with a medium white head. Aroma is incredibly juicy. So much fresh citrus, sweet pressed oranges, light passion fruit tropicalness, fresh mosaic. Wow! Taste is juicy, dank, hoppy, lots of classic mosaic notes, dry, bitter. Amazing use of my favorite hop!

(on tap @ Taphouse) Poured a hazy amber with medium white head. Good retention and beautiful lace. Aroma is pure mosaic goodness with plenty of tropical fruit and a bit of onion. Oily texture, medium to light body, soft carbonation despite lively activity of bubbles and a dry finish. Flavour pretty much follows the aroma. Has a very clean and extremely drinkable Mosaic hop expression that is extremely sessionable.

On tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a hazy golden orange with a soapy, short lasting, white head. Aroma has lots of mosaic hops, sweet grape fruit, orange, tangerine, pale malty bread, light acidity. Taste is fairly intense for the ABV. Super fresh mosaic hoppy, bitter, dry bready, citrus, pear, passion fruit. High carbonation and a light, crisp body. Tasty.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - golden pour with nice puffy white covering. Medium sweet tropical and citrus fruity and hoppy, with some great tangerine and peachy hits, light malty, solid hoppy bitter finish. Highly quaffable, lovely stuff, ended up drinking lots of this last night, great to see some hometown beers over here!
hazy yellow collor with a light white head. floral aroma with grassy hints. taste light to medium bitter, with hints of sweetness light bodied. soft carbonated.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours slightly hazy dark yellow with a white hea, lacings. Aroma of light malt, nice fresh fruity hops, peach, mango, citrus. Flavor is light malt, fruity hops, peach, mango. Medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish. Nice drinkabilty. 050116

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - fruity and flowers. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 050115

Tap @ "Fermentoren, Aarhus as "11 03", 3,9%. Hazy golden with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, earthy and peach. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, peach, earthy, little sweet and medium bitter.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, fruits, malt, citrus and has a nice fruity and bitter finish.

Golden color, off-white head. Passion fruit nose, grapefruit, peach, hint of grass. Grapefruit taste, resin, tropical fruit, grass, light malty, moderate bitterness. Light body, soft carbonation. Very fruity, clean and crisp. One of the best Session IPAs I have tasted.
Tåkete lys brun tåkete med lavt hvitt skum. Lukter blomster og stikkelsbær. Sørbittet smak, noe syrlig, rognebær og stikkelsbær. Kraftig lang bittersyrlig avslutning.

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours hazy golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, grape, pine, herbal and passion fruit. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with a long dry, citrus, passion fruit and piney finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle at home, bought at the brewery. Much, much much better than the Simcoe. Nice smell, exotic fruits, bitter taste, refresher, not too wattery. Perfect Session IPA.

Keg at the brewery. Hazy orange/golden body with a medium white head. Good lacing. Aroma of pineapple, orange and grapefruit. Flavour of pithy orange and Um Bongo. Medium body with an oily texture. Light fizz. A tropical fruit bomb. Delicious.

Beer from Beersiveknown, cheers Steve! Aroma: Intensive mosaic: red and tropical fruit, spruce, lemon and grapefruit, great. Appearance: light golden, head is medium high, quickly disappears. Taste: Light, crisp, medium bitter, bit too watery, hoppy notes less intensive: tropical fruit and spruce. Palate: Body is low, carbonation is low, finish is dry with some pleasantly lingering bitterness. Nice session IPA.

Bottle. Pours golden with a hwite head. Aroma of passionfruit, weed, some fruitiness and herbs. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some passionfruit, orange, lime and herbal bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. It pours a lightly hazy golden body under a small, off-white head. The aroma has lots of passionfruit, some orange and a pineapple touch. Biscuity pale malts in the back. Its quite bitter in the mouth, dry and softly carbonated, medium bodied and with a good bitterness. Passionfruit, grapefruit, pine cone hints and a backdrop of pale malts. Lasting bitter and fruity finish. Im pretty sure this one would be even better with some more body and alcohol, but on the other hand, that could jeopardize the dryness. 151124

07.11.2015, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head, quite hazy. Aroma is fresh grassy, leafs, fresh hops, leafs, moss, lawn, light malts, hay, minerals, hints of pine needles. Taste is dry grassy, leafs, hops, lawn, citrus peel, pine needles, bark, hay, light malts, minerals. Medium bitterness, dry mouthfeel. Nice.
Bardzo aromatyczne, w zapachu wypełnione pełną gamą tropikalnych owoców, Dość mocno wysycone. Chmielowa uczta.

WoW. More or less just perfect session ale for hop heads! Can not find anything to complain about. Lovely unclear golden color. Nice head. Lovely hoppy aroma. Fine body and a fine carbonation. Good balance between sweetness and bitterness. Citric hoppy, tropical and pine in the flavor. Oh yes![Bottle from The Vineyard in Belfast, Northern Ireland]

Golden colour. Beautiful piney fresh hop nose. Tropical taste typical of Mosaic - pineapple, mango & lychees. The best session IPA I've had in a while.

Rated by BrewTom

Brew by numbers mosaic session IPA 



Bottle. A honey gold with a fantastic tropical fruit nose of mango, passionfruit & papaya. Remarkably raspy carbonation they while sweet has a tongue scraping bitterness. The taste is tropical, woodsy/earthy hops, light malt presence and high flavor - very juicy. Damn good.
Keg at the brewery. Good, dank Mosaic nose. Biscuit malt flavor, tropical fruit, dank. Very nice.
On tap at Biercab. Golden colour with white head. Fruity, peach aroma. Sweet, fruity, juice, peach, citric taste. Medium body.
smelt grapefruity and grassy, amber gold colour with white lacing tastes as per the aroma, pretty good.
Poured light to medium amber with an off white head. Aroma of moderately sweet citrus. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, light nutty bitterness.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grassy citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity malty grassy citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty grassy citrus hoppy finish.
Hazy dark orange golden with a medium white head. Aroma is grass, mango and hops. Taste is pineapple, hops and a bit citrus

Bottled. Orange colour, small off-white creamy head. Aroma is fruity, floral, some slight bready notes along with quite a strong herbal touch to it. Flavour is herbal, grassy, some bready notes along with mild nectary and floral notes.

Tap. Hazy, deep golden body with a small off-white head. Aroma of grapefruit, lime, mango and pine. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and nicebitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice IPA.
Keg at the brewery. Pours hazy deep golden with a creamy white head. The aroma is exotic fruits and pale malts. Flavor is citric and exotic hoppy.
Draught at Mikkeller&Friends, Copenhagen. Hazy pale golden beer with a small offwhite head. Hoppy fruity aroma.Hoppy, fruity flavour. Refreshing nice beer:-)

Bottle at another tasting. Slightly hazy very pale gold pour with no real head. Aroma is super grassy, dank hoppy notes, weed, really nice fresh hoppiness. Taste is hoppy, not too bitter, really nice fruity hop, typical golden blond /session pale ale aka delicious. Palate is light, really dry. Tasty stuff.

Bottle @ Another Tasting, courtesy of dEnk. Pours a clear golden beer with a white head on top. Aroma has massive grapefruit going on, big citric, light herbal. Flavor is medium bitter, very grassy, light bitter aftertaste. Aftertaste is very thin, watery mouthfeel. Nice stuff.

Bottle shared at Another Tasting thanks to Denk. Pours slightly hazy golden with a small off white head. Aroma is big grassy and weedy hops, citrus and grapefruit. Flavour is light sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

Bottle at Another Tasting, hosted by MrHangover. Hazy golden pour, no head. Aroma is very fruity, citrus, grassy and floral. Flavor is quite bitter, citrus, lemon peel and fruity. Smooth texture and nice balance.

Bottle from the brewery. It pours a clear golden orange colour with a medium soapy white head. Aroma is grassy, flowery and resiny. Taste is moderately bitter with grass, violets and pine needles. Mouthfeel is medium with good carbonation. Overall, a very nice and hoppy pale ale.

330ml bottle from Trembling Madness Drinks Shop, York. Hazy yellow golden colour, frothy white foam head leaving alittle lacing and aroma of passionfruit, zesty lemon and orange citrus, hoppy. Taste is malt caramel balanced with juicy tropical fruit, hop resin and tangy grapefruit bitterness. Smoothish mouthfeel, light bodied, soft carbonation, dry hoppy bitter finish. Very drinkable.

Bottle @ home. Slightly hazy yellow color, small to average sized white head. Aroma is lovely hoppy, grassy and fruity. Taste is full of hops as well, though subtle, gentle, not as up front. Nice smooth hoppyness, lightly floral, grassy, fruity. Softly bitter in the finish. Suitable body and suitable soft carbonation. Very nice!
Pours a golden slightly unclear beer with a good white head. Smells fruity, mango, peach. Tastes fruity, citrus and mango. Average carbo, thin body and a dry texture.
bottle from brewery i really liked this beer was so easy to drink and has some very good flavours going on a nice fuity flavour throughout the beer with a good hop kick at the end

1/3 pint, keg at Mother Kellys Bottle & Tap Room, Bethnal Green. Pale golden, missing head, dotted spots to the glassware. Grass and peach to the nose. Fruity flavours of pineapple, peach and pine. Herbal hops to the aftertaste. Medium to thin bodied. Clean and satisfying (London 26.09.2014).

Draught at the Brew By Numbers Brewery on 11 Oct. Poured a hazy golden colour, with a dense white head. Aroma of grassy hop, melon and lychee. Chalky flavour, with straw and mango sweetness. Finish was tinned fruit, brown sugar and biscuit.
Bottle @ home. Aroma is huge citrus, mandarin, pine and other fruity hop notes. Flavour is a fresh and full fruity piney zesty hop flavour with a hint of malt. Awesome (session) ale.
Very good session IPA, easily drinkable, not my favourite style as I like aggressive flavours, but good at what its trying to be.

From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, light peachy and grapefruity. Toasted and light fruity. Bitter, fruity and peachy. Mild grapefruity. Dry and slight herbal into the finish.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a hazy light amber with a thin broken white head. The aroma is yeast, sherbet zesty citrus, grassy nettle hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a big grass nettle hoppy bitter palate with a lingering bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation. A real grass bucket beer!
Fad, Mikkeller & Friends. Uklar gylden, hvidt skum. Masser af Mosaic i næsen: svedig t-shirt, moden tropisk frugt og jordslåede fodboldstøvler. Frugtig, let malt-sødme, supersprød.
Draught at Mikkeller&Friends. Clear yellow - white head. High mosaic. Fruity. Toasted. Forrest. Light tropic. Herbal notes. Super fresh and clean.

Draft. A hazy golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of spices, Moasiac hops, and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of spices, malt, lemons, and Mosaic hops, leading to a bitter finish.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Hazy golden colored with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and citrus peel with notes of pine needles.
Fruity flavor of hops and pine needles with notes of citrus peel.
Hoppy finish.

Draught at Mikkeller&Friends, Copenhagen. Hazy pale golden with a small offwhite head. Hoppy fruity aroma, peach, grapes, hay, passion fruit, pine apples, oranges, pine notes. Hoppy pine flavor, passion fruit, citrus, peach, floral, pine apples, biscuit notes, hay, some grapes. Hugely refreshing.
Keg brew dog Sheff. Gilden thin head. Aroma is tropical hops. Taste is Same dry hop bitter finish. Medium body. Ok stuff
Brewdog bar, sheffield. Yellow ale with thin head. Aroma is grapefruit, bitn of lychee, and then loads more grapefruit. Taste is all grapefruit too. Medium carbonation and quite thin body.
330ml bottle from Brew By Numbers Brewery. Yellow amber, not much head. Flowery hop aroma. Woody mango grain flavour. A bit watery.

Clear pale amber, small head that dissipates quickly. Fantastic fruity aroma, promises a rich and complex fruitiness that it doesnt entirely deliver, but not far off. Soft fruit flavours, light malt, a bit of pine. Ends with a robust but not overwhelming bitterness. Light carbonation, light bodied, perhaps a little watery. Really good overall.
Nice fruity beer that i could drink lots of but too many others to try,Bottle at evening star brighton. Not much of carbonation, lacing or head. Crisp, cold beer.
Bottle 33cl from AbM @ home. Pours hazy orange, small white head. Tropical fruit, citrus, Crisp, bitter, juicy, fruity flavor. Very nice session brew.
Keg at the hanging bat.... Hazy golden amber... Thin white lacing... Dry zezty fruits... Soft floral fruit nose... Light fizz... Dry zezty hop... Light thin body

Bottle from BrewDog online. It pours hazy golden with a decent white head. The nose is sweet, doughy, plenty of tropical fruits....juicy mango, passion fruit, papaya and hay. The taste is crisp, bitter, peppery spice, grapefruit, straw, lemon peel, light soap and pine needles with a dry finish. Light-medium body and fine carbonation. Crisp and refreshing.

330ml bottle. Slightly cloudy, orangey golden colour with average, thick, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Tropical fruity, hoppy aroma, notes of mango, passion fruit, some orange zest. Taste is bitter hoppy, tropical fruity, mango and passion fruit again, slightly chalky sub-line, weak, not fully sustainable malt basis. Very nice. Perfect, if only the chalky, mineral touch would be absorbed by a more robust malt basis. Mosaic is todays top hop.

330ml bottle from Ales by Mail

Pours dark orange with a small head. Aroma of zesty tropical fruits, citrus, caramel, grass, some maltiness. Taste is wet hoppy, zesty tropical fruity, citrusy and caramely with some grass and pine. Finish is juicy fruity, crisp malty and caramely. Nice. Mosaic has quickly became one of my favorite hops.

Bottle bought as take out in CBC Clapham. Colour is rich orange, cloudy, some floaty bits in the bottom because it hadnt settled entirely before I poured, and a medium bright white nice light foam head with good lacing. Nose has a lovely hit of sour passion fruit at first, some mango, green leafy hop resin, pine, orange citrous. Im looking out for the mosaic bubblegum and theres a wee bit of it. Taste is earthy, fresh rain on tarmac, pine, quite hop bitter.
330ml bottle from Brewdog AGM. Pours hazy golden yellow, thin white head. Good light fruit aromas, mango and pineapple, light citrus. Taste is light bitter. Decent body. Bitter finish. Good.
UPDATED: JUL 15, 2014 Session IPA, great hop aroma and flavour, and with its low abv, a light, crisp taste. Wonderful session beer.

Bottle at the brewery. Hazy amber lasting off white head. Some tropical fruit. Moderate sweaty earthiness. Yep its sweaty sox like sub standard Nelson Sauvin can be. Not great not bad. Not to my flavour though.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ from ales by mailHazy amber with pillowy beige head. Pithy aroma, soft body and moderate carbonation. Dry bitterness, juicy hops, a little rough around the edges and the usual mosaic berry fruit s nowhere to be found. Not a big fan.

Bottle from Salusbury Wine Store on recommendation. Does all the things a light modern PA should do. Glorious delicate tropical fruits, fantastic zippy light palate and long dry end. I often find a few hoppy PAs can leave my mouth like a boozy Sahara, but this is tempered here by the lightness of touch. Good stuff.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Cloudy yellow coloured with a sweet tropical juicy fruit flavour, grapefruit notes and a slight woody finish.

Bottle from the brewery. Cloudy, orange squash colour. Thin, bubbly, white head. Tropical fruit. Pink grapefruit. Ripe nectarine. Smells lovely. Taste is pithy dry and pithy bitter. Airy palate. Bit of crunch. Finish sets off dry, then long, but light bitter. Very nice.

7th June 2014hazy gold beer, tiny bubbly white head. Big passion fruit nose. Palate is light and crisp. Mild minerals. Very light malt. Bitterish passion fruit hops. Finishes light and airy with a moderate bitter linger, Nice flavours but a tad thin.

Bottle at home, from Bottledog, 09/06/14.
Hazed golden orange with a good sized off whit head that retains well.
Nose is juicy citrics, grapefruit rinse, grassy, mandarin, light bread dough, juicy citric hops - great aromas.
Taste carries a big pine bite, skunky mosaic wash, orange pith, bitter grapefruit, citric peel.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, juicy hop bitterness and citricana lacing in the close.
Top notch sessioner, lots of pine, juicy hop and mosaic goodness!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 330mL bottle, pours an opaque golden orange with a medium white head. Nose brings out tropical fruits, dry astringent resinous hops, and dry biscuity malt. Flavour is fairly dry and astringent, with resinous and piney hops. Very dry and biscuity on the finish. Very good.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy amber pour with a thin white head, amazing tropical hop aroma of pine, tangerine, taste doesnt live up to aroma bit still great, taste is citrus with light pine a hint of grapefruit some apricot a crisp malt background, very good.

On tap at the brewery. Nice pale colour with thick creamy white head. Carbonation is great and there is a lot of lacing. Aroma is very fruity - peach and and mango, as well as some piney and citrus notes. Moderate bitterness with a smooth and carbonated mouthfeel. Overall it is an excellent pale ale and drank loads of it while it was on tap at the brewery. I had it on cask last week and it's also a great session ale.
user_location: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at home in London - picked up at the brewery. Pours clear, bright gold, effervescent with a thick, lasting frothy white head. It looks pretty much perfect. The aroma is great, with lots of pithy citrus, grapefruit, tangerine, some pee, a bit of pine and straw. Light sweet flavor with cleansing mineral notes, dry pale malts, further dry and pithy citrus fruits, especially grapefruit, some bitter lemon rind. Light bodied with fine to average, massaging carbonation. Finishes with great balance, lots more grapefruit, slight papaya, mellow hop oils, pine, straw. Extremely drinkable beer. Superb balance overall. This makes for an outstanding warm weather quencher.

Cask hand pump at the Gun Docklands spring haze beer fest. Hazed golden orange colour with a thin white head. Aroma is mixed tropical fruit, fruit salad, mineral , pineapple, lychee. Flavour is again nice fruits, lychee and peach, peach melba. Slight pithy feeling in the mouth. Clean base malt. Low bitterness. palate is a bit flabby on cask. Nice hop hit with good tropical fruits.
